channel.title: declineTrade(boolean) issue
channel.description:
The server files are being compiled. PlayerHandler.java:295: declineTrade(boolean) in client cannot be applied to () p.declineTrade(); ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
how do i fix this? this happended when i tryed2add some stuff but i 4got wut, but anyways long story short i got the errors down to just this one, any help?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 23, 2009, 05:01:56 pm[/size][hr]client.java:287: ';' expected public boolean declinetrade { update on my error!^^^^

item.title: declineTrade(boolean) issue
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

declineTrade(boolean) means it requires a boolean as an argument, i.e declineTrade(false). I’m guessing if you want to decline the trade, you need to pass ‘false’, and if (wait, why are you invoking a method called ‘declineTrade(boolean’ if you don’t want decline the trade?) you don’t want to decline, pass ‘true’.

Read full topic
